component_analysis.volatility_score: 8/10 - Options imply 15.5% move vs historical 13.3% average
component_analysis.momentum_score: 6/10 - Stock up 45% YTD but down 8% past month
component_analysis.fundamental_score: 5/10 - High valuation at 2.5x P/S, improving margins

CVNA.key_insight: Carvana's implied volatility is elevated due to binary outcome: either continued execution on path to profitability or disappointment from stretched valuation. Historical pattern shows 60% probability of >10% move post-earnings.
CVNA.specific_trade_setup: Strangle: Buy Feb 21 $340 put ($8.50) and $360 call ($9.20). Total cost: $17.70. Breakevens: $322.30 or $377.70 (9.5% move). Target: 20% return if stock moves >15% ($21.24). Annualized return: 85%.
risk_factors: Impact: High - Miss could drop stock 20-30%
Probability: 40% - Valuation stretched, auto cycle concerns
Mitigation: Position size 1% of portfolio, defined risk
CVNA.bottom_line: High-risk, high-reward earnings play with elevated volatility premium justifying option purchase.

component_analysis.sentiment_score: 3/10 - Only 45% analyst buy ratings, recent miss

DASH.key_insight: DoorDash faces perfect storm: food delivery growth slowing, grocery/retail expansion costly, and regulatory headwinds. Last quarter's miss (-20% vs estimates) suggests execution challenges.
DASH.specific_trade_setup: Bear put spread: Buy Feb 21 $125 put ($4.80), sell $115 put ($2.30). Net debit: $2.50. Max profit: $7.50 (300%) if <$115. Target: 35% return. Annualized: 92%.
risk_factors: Impact: Medium - Could rally on cost control improvements
Mitigation: Defined risk spread, 0.75% position size
DASH.bottom_line: Bearish bias justified by deteriorating fundamentals and technical breakdown.

EBAY.key_insight: eBay's transformation to focused categories and advertising monetization showing results, but growth remains modest vs e-commerce peers. Stable cash flow supports dividend.
EBAY.specific_trade_setup: Iron condor: Sell Feb 21 $52.50 call ($1.20), buy $55 call ($0.40), sell $47.50 put ($1.10), buy $45 put ($0.30). Net credit: $1.60. Max profit: $160 per contract. Annualized: 42%.
EBAY.bottom_line: Range-bound earnings play collecting premium in low-volatility environment.

RELY.key_insight: Remitly benefits from structural tailwinds: digital remittance adoption, immigrant population growth, and cross-selling opportunities. Valuation reasonable at 3.5x forward sales.
RELY.specific_trade_setup: Bull call spread: Buy Feb 21 $17.50 call ($1.40), sell $20 call ($0.50). Net debit: $0.90. Max profit: $1.60 (178%) if >$20. Target: 45% return. Annualized: 110%.
risk_factors: Impact: Medium - FX volatility could impact margins
Mitigation: Position size 1.5%, stop at $0.45 debit
RELY.bottom_line: High-growth fintech with reasonable valuation and positive earnings catalyst potential.

WMT.key_insight: Walmart capturing trade-down from higher-income shoppers while maintaining low-income base. Advertising business ($3B+) growing 30%+ with high margins.
WMT.specific_trade_setup: Cash-secured put: Sell Feb 28 $67.50 put for $1.20 premium. Return: 1.8% in 10 days. Annualized: 47%. Assignment price: 22x P/E reasonable.
risk_factors: Mitigation: Willing to own at $66.30 effective price
WMT.bottom_line: High-quality defensive name for premium collection with low risk of catastrophic loss.

LMND.key_insight: Lemonade's AI claims processing advantage not translating to underwriting profitability. Insurance remains tough business with long loss tail discovery.
LMND.specific_trade_setup: Straddle: Buy Feb 21 $22.50 put ($1.30) and call ($1.20). Total cost: $2.50. Breakevens: $20 or $25 (11% move). Target: 25% return. Annualized: 65%.
risk_factors: Impact: High - Binary outcome on path to profitability
LMND.bottom_line: Pure volatility play on unprofitable insurtech with binary earnings outcome.

KLAR.key_insight: Klarna's BNPL model gaining merchant adoption beyond retail into travel/services. European market leadership provides scale advantages over US competitors.
KLAR.specific_trade_setup: Bull call spread: Buy Feb 21 $8.50 call ($0.60), sell $10 call ($0.20). Net debit: $0.40. Max profit: $1.10 (275%) if >$10. Target: 50% return. Annualized: 120%.
risk_factors: Impact: Medium - Regulatory scrutiny on BNPL
Probability: 35% - Credit losses higher than expected
KLAR.bottom_line: Growth fintech with reasonable valuation and clear path to profitability.

VC.key_insight: Visteon's digital cockpit and display business benefiting from EV transition (higher content per vehicle), but exposed to auto production cycles.
VC.specific_trade_setup: Iron butterfly: Sell Feb 21 $122.50 call ($2.50) and put ($2.40), buy $125 call ($1.20) and $120 put ($1.10). Net credit: $2.60. Max profit: $260 per contract. Annualized: 38%.
risk_factors: Probability: 40% - EV transition slower than expected
VC.bottom_line: Auto supplier with EV exposure but cyclical risks warrant neutral strategy.

W.key_insight: Wayfair faces perfect storm: housing slowdown reducing furniture demand, high shipping costs, and intense competition from Amazon/Target.
W.specific_trade_setup: Bear put spread: Buy Feb 21 $62.50 put ($2.80), sell $57.50 put ($1.40). Net debit: $1.40. Max profit: $3.60 (257%) if <$57.50. Target: 55% return. Annualized: 55%.
risk_factors: Impact: Medium - Could bounce on cost cutting
W.bottom_line: Bearish play on cyclical furniture retailer facing multiple headwinds.

DAVA.key_insight: Endava benefits from digital transformation spending, particularly in financial services and healthcare. Reasonable valuation at 18x forward earnings.
DAVA.specific_trade_setup: Bull call spread: Buy Feb 21 $32.50 call ($1.80), sell $35 call ($0.80). Net debit: $1.00. Max profit: $1.50 (150%) if >$35. Target: 85% return. Annualized: 85%.
DAVA.bottom_line: Quality IT services play with growth at reasonable price.

NICE.key_insight: NICE's cloud contact center software benefiting from AI integration and digital customer service transformation. High retention rates (90%+) and upselling opportunities.
NICE.specific_trade_setup: Cash-secured put: Sell Feb 28 $87.50 put for $2.10 premium. Return: 2.4% in 10 days. Annualized: 52%. Assignment price: 25x P/E reasonable for growth.
risk_factors: Impact: Low - Recurring revenue model stable
Mitigation: Willing to own at $85.40 effective price
NICE.bottom_line: High-quality SaaS business for premium collection with defensive characteristics.
